name: Victoria Hurley
strapLine: Developing web apps that are engaging and accessible
intros: I journeyed into web development by ways of Wordpress, initially creating sites using pre-built themes for fun. As with many developers, curiosity got the better of me and I wanted to find out how things worked and what more could be done. I started coding with HTML, CSS and JavaScript and from there found my way into Angular development.
I have experience as an Angular developer for a RegTech company who offer a subscription service to a regulatory compliance app for insurance companies.

I have spent the last three years working on a projects for British Airways. I have been involved in re-platforming projects using Angular 16, accessibility improvement projects and re-design projects aimed at bringing customers a better user experience.

experiences.title: Frontend Software Engineer
description: I am currently employed by Leighton and have been out on contract with British Airways consistently since joining the team. At BA I have been involved in a variety of projects including building apps with Angular and AWS (predonminantly front end but also assisting in back end tasks), page redesign projects and accessibility improvement.

experiences.title: Frontend Software Engineer
description: At REG technologies as part of the development team I helped build, maintain and design their subscription app. This app is used to assist regulated businesses in the insurance sector towards being compliant. I worked on developing many new features including document exchange, dashboards and the international regulators project.

projects.title: Todo's MEAN app
projects.description: A MEAN todo's app where you can add, edit, delete, mark as complete, filter and count your todo list items. Built in Angular using signals with a Node, Express and MongoDB backend.

projects.title: Recipe search
projects.description: A little app that uses a third party API to search for and filter recipes by number of ingredients and diet type. View a recipe to see nutrition information or visit the site the information was taken from.

courses.title: Angular and NodeJS: The MEAN stack guide (2024 edition)
Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery with GitLab
Learning Amazon Web Services (AWS) for Deverlopers

buildInfo.intro: This portfolio was built with Angular 18 in Visual Studio Code and deployed with GitHub.
